I think this ‚Äúquestion‚Äù violates Particles community guidelines article 2 ‚ÄúYour question must be a question. Questions should be asked in good faith and not be purely rhetorical.‚Äù, because it isn‚Äôt a real question rather a statement or rhetorical question. But I think the answer to this statement by the AI might still be insightful, because it clearly states the misconception of the user. *Feedback provided on question*: Request: Semantics. Call it what you want but the EU charges VAT TO basically all products imported into the EU. Appx 4-10-21%, depending in the product. The EU makes money. A tariff is a tax on products entering into a country. I don‚Äôt care what you call it, bit isn‚Äôt a tax a tax? One fills the coffers the same as the other. Response: VAT taxes consumption; tariffs target imports. Cluster: Trump Imposes 30% Tariffs on EU and Mexican Imports (_Updated 3 hr ago_)
